dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: ...so, like, another committee meeting about… tariffs? Ugh.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: ...so, like, another committee meeting about... tariffs? Ugh.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, no, wait. This is actually, um, kinda important, for real.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, no, wait. This is actually, um, kinda important, for real.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Important how? Sounds like just another way to raise our housing bills without, you know, actually fixing anything.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Important how? Sounds like just another way to raise our housing bills without, you know, actually fixing anything.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, it's about avoiding those, like, really lengthy approval processes. Currently, maslikhats approve them, but it’s super slow.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, it's about avoiding those, like, really lengthy approval processes. Currently, maslikhats approve them, but it's super slow.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The draft law on housing and utilities discusses linking housing maintenance tariffs to the monthly calculation index (MCI) to avoid lengthy approvals at the maslikhat level. This was reported by Deputy Yekaterina Smyshlyayeva. According to the deputy, housing maintenance tariffs are currently approved by maslikhats, but the process is slow.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: "Super slow" meaning people complain about price hikes, so they just don't approve them, and then buildings fall apart. Right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Super slow meaning people complain about price hikes, so they just don't approve them, and then buildings fall apart. Right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tariff increases often cause public dissatisfaction, leading regional authorities to either delay their revision or not review them at all, complicating the maintenance of apartment buildings.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! So, Deputy Smyshlyayeva, she's proposing linking tariffs to the MCI.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! So, Deputy Smyshlyayeva, she's proposing linking tariffs to the M C I.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This was reported by Deputy Yekaterina Smyshlyayeva. ... "We understand that, in addition to management, preserving the housing stock is also important. That™s why we are discussing linking the tariff to the MCI so that it is automatically indexed..."

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: The M-C-I. Yeah, right. More acronyms. What does that even mean for me?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The M-C-I. Yeah, right. More acronyms. What does that even mean for me?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's the Monthly Calculation Index. The idea is it makes it automatic. So, like, the tariffs index themselves.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's the Monthly Calculation Index. The idea is it makes it automatic. So, like, the tariffs index themselves.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The draft law on housing and utilities discusses linking housing maintenance tariffs to the monthly calculation index (MCI) to avoid lengthy approvals at the maslikhat level. ... "That™s why we are discussing linking the tariff to the MCI so that it is automatically indexed..."

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Automatically index. So, automatically go up. Great.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Automatically index. So, automatically go up. Great.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But the point is, it avoids maslikhats having to, like, revisit it for years. It's supposed to ensure buildings are maintained.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But the point is, it avoids maslikhats having to, like, revisit it for years. It's supposed to ensure buildings are maintained.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: "...allowing maslikhats to avoid revisiting this issue for several years," the deputy said during a Majilis session.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, 'supposed to'. What about what we think? Are we just along for the ride now?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, 'supposed to'. What about what we think? Are we just along for the ride now?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, they are also considering housing quality when setting these. Like, age of the building, technical facilities...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, they are also considering housing quality when setting these. Like, age of the building, technical facilities...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The draft law also proposes considering housing quality when determining tariffs. Specifically, coefficients will be introduced based on factors such as the building's age, the presence of technical facilities, and other characteristics.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, old buildings pay more or less? What's the scam there?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, old buildings pay more or less? What's the scam there?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, coefficients. They'll be included by default. You won't vote on that minimum.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, coefficients. They'll be included by default. You won't vote on that minimum.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: These coefficients will be included in the minimum tariff by default and will not require residents™ voting.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But! If you want, um, additional services, that does still require a general vote from homeowners.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But! If you want, um, additional services, that does still require a general vote from homeowners.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: However, additional services, if needed, will be approved by a general vote of homeowners.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Additional services. Like, a gold-plated front door? I guess that's something.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Additional services. Like, a gold-plated front door? I guess that's something.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, it's a significant effort to improve the whole tariff-setting system, you know? It's not just a cash grab.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, it's a significant effort to improve the whole tariff-setting system, you know? It's not just a cash grab.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Smyshlyayeva added that significant work is currently underway to improve the tariff-setting system in the housing and utilities sector.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Hmm. We'll see if my building actually gets fixed then.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hmm. We'll see if my building actually gets fixed then.
